headline.main: Shoplifting Suspect Shot After Running Over Deputies
headline.print_headline: Shoplifting Suspect Shot After Running Over Deputies

docs.snippet: A shoplifting suspect wanted on prior assault and theft warrants was fatally shot by a Tennessee sheriff's officer in a parking lot after hitting two lawmen with his car while trying to flee, authorities said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A shoplifting suspect wanted on prior assault and theft warrants was fatally shot by a Tennessee sheriff's officer in a parking lot after hitting two lawmen with his car while trying to flee, authorities said.

headline.main: Vatican's Ex-No. 2 Seeks to Make Amends for Hospital Scandal
headline.print_headline: Vatican's Ex-No. 2 Seeks to Make Amends for Hospital Scandal

docs.snippet: An Italian cardinal whose penthouse apartment was reportedly renovated using funds from a Vatican-owned children's hospital is making a large donation for medical research in a bid to make amends, the hospital's president said Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Italian cardinal whose penthouse apartment was reportedly renovated using funds from a Vatican-owned children's hospital is making a large donation for medical research in a bid to make amends, the hospital's president said Saturday.

headline.main: U.S. Reports 20 Strikes Against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria
headline.print_headline: U.S. Reports 20 Strikes Against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria

docs.snippet: The United States and its allies staged 20 strikes against Islamic State militants in Iraq and Syria on Friday, including one near the Iraqi city of Fallujah that is being investigated as a possible friendly fire incident, the coalition leading th...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States and its allies staged 20 strikes against Islamic State militants in Iraq and Syria on Friday, including one near the Iraqi city of Fallujah that is being investigated as a possible friendly fire incident, the coalition leading the operations said on Saturday.

headline.main: Alleged Robber Fatally Shot by Off-Duty Police Officer
headline.print_headline: Alleged Robber Fatally Shot by Off-Duty Police Officer

docs.snippet: A man is dead after he allegedly attempted to rob an off-duty Baltimore city police officer in Anne Arundel County with a toy gun and was shot by the officer....
docs.lead_paragraph: A man is dead after he allegedly attempted to rob an off-duty Baltimore city police officer in Anne Arundel County with a toy gun and was shot by the officer.

headline.main: Northrop Says U.S. Air Force Picked Right Team for Bomber Contract
headline.print_headline: Northrop Says U.S. Air Force Picked Right Team for Bomber Contract

docs.snippet: Northrop Grumman Corp said on Saturday that it won a U.S. Air Force contract to build a new long-range bomber after a very thorough selection process and it argued that a new legal brief filed by Boeing Co had no merit....
docs.lead_paragraph: Northrop Grumman Corp said on Saturday that it won a U.S. Air Force contract to build a new long-range bomber after a very thorough selection process and it argued that a new legal brief filed by Boeing Co had no merit.

headline.main: Medical Record Shows Hitler Only Had One Testicle: Media
headline.print_headline: Medical Record Shows Hitler Only Had One Testicle: Media

docs.snippet: A medical document shows that Adolf Hitler only had one testicle, German media said on Saturday, suggesting there is  some truth after all to a popular British song that says the dictator had "only got one ball"....
docs.lead_paragraph: A medical document shows that Adolf Hitler only had one testicle, German media said on Saturday, suggesting there is  some truth after all to a popular British song that says the dictator had "only got one ball".

headline.main: 5-Year Deal Between Nexteer, Union Easily Wins Approval
headline.print_headline: 5-Year Deal Between Nexteer, Union Easily Wins Approval

docs.snippet: Union members at a major Michigan auto supplier approved a five-year contract, officials said Saturday, just a few weeks after rejecting the first deal and staging a brief strike....
docs.lead_paragraph: Union members at a major Michigan auto supplier approved a five-year contract, officials said Saturday, just a few weeks after rejecting the first deal and staging a brief strike.

headline.main: US Embassy in Pakistan Warns of Possible Terror Attacks
headline.print_headline: US Embassy in Pakistan Warns of Possible Terror Attacks

docs.snippet: The U.S. Embassy in Islamabad said it has received information on possible terrorist attacks in the Pakistani capital in late December, warning Americans to avoid busy public places during the Christmas and New Year holiday period....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Embassy in Islamabad said it has received information on possible terrorist attacks in the Pakistani capital in late December, warning Americans to avoid busy public places during the Christmas and New Year holiday period.

headline.main: More Colleges Seek Exemption From LGBT Anti-Bias Rules, Rights Group Says
headline.print_headline: More Colleges Seek Exemption From LGBT Anti-Bias Rules, Rights Group Says

docs.snippet: A growing number of U.S. universities are seeking religious exemptions from civil rights laws barring discrimination against lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) students, according to a report by LGBT advocacy group Human Rights Campaign...
docs.lead_paragraph: A growing number of U.S. universities are seeking religious exemptions from civil rights laws barring discrimination against lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) students, according to a report by LGBT advocacy group Human Rights Campaign.

headline.main: NY Philharmonic Says German Conductor Kurt Masur Dead at 88
headline.print_headline: NY Philharmonic Says German Conductor Kurt Masur Dead at 88

docs.snippet: Conductor Kurt Masur, who was credited with helping prevent violence after the collapse of communism in East Germany and later reinvigorated the New York Philharmonic during an 11-year stint as music director, has died at 88....
docs.lead_paragraph: Conductor Kurt Masur, who was credited with helping prevent violence after the collapse of communism in East Germany and later reinvigorated the New York Philharmonic during an 11-year stint as music director, has died at 88.
